alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 2:01PM MST until August 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 159 PM MST, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Cornfields, Sunrise Springs and Klagetoh. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Klagetoh, Cornfields Chapter House, Sunrise Springs, Wide Ruins, Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Burnside, Ganado and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 427 and 435...and between mile markers 441 and 446. Highway 191 between mile markers 385 and 411. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oak Ridge Wash, Steamboat Wash, Bent Knee Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, Sabito Wash and Big Dam Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
